Statistics Class Reference

#include <Statistics.h>

Detailed Description

Statistics about a text and its recognition process.

This class stores a number of statistic data regarding the recognition process and the text produced.

First, it stores the elapsed time on every stage, accumulated internally in the critical processes (mostly, image processing algorithms). Then, it computes the number of words in the text and the appearance rate of every single word.

Author:
Eliezer Talón (elitalon@gmail.com)
Date:
2008-09-17

double charactersExtractionTime ()
 Returns the elapsed time while extracting characters within the classification stage.

 Returns the elapsed time while building feature vectors within the classification stage.
double classificationTime ()
 Returns the total time within the classification stage.
double thresholdingTime ()
 Returns the elapsed time while thresholding the clip within the segmentation stage.
double floodFillingTime ()
 Returns the elapsed time while applying the 'Flood fill' algorithm within the segmentation stage.
double segmentationTime ()
 Returns the total time within the segmentation stage.
double grayscaleConversionTime ()
 Returns the time elapsed while converting the clip's color space to grayscale within the preprocessing stage.
double noiseRemovalTime ()
 Returns the time elapsed while removing the noise in the clip within the preprocessing stage.
double preprocessingTime ()
 Returns the total time within the preprocessing stage.
unsigned int nWords ()
 Returns the number of words in the recognized text.
list< WordRate > wordRates ()
 Returns the list of appearance rates of every word in text.

Member Function Documentation

double Statistics::classificationTime (  ) 

Returns the total time within the classification stage.

The total time spent is computed by adding the elapsed time in individual steps.
